title: After the update
content: After the update, the name of the "Spam" folder (Japanese) changed to "Junk" (English), and similarly the name of the trash folder (Japanese) changed to "Trash" (English). As a result, it now freezes on startup. It's very difficult to use.
creator: taka0911

title: Can't rename IMAP folder
content: Hello! Thunderbird has updated to version 144. All folders on the IMAP server have been renamed to their default values. Now, when I go to a folder's properties, I can't change its name. The input field is now read-only. Everything was fine before the update.
creator: santila12

title: Time Machine backup of Thunderbird
content: Hello, I am using Time Machine to backup my Mac, but the tool excludes Thunderbird. In settings I have not excluded any files. My Thunderbird folder is fairly large, 25GB - thanks to the great archiving features of Thunderbird, How can I include Thunderbird folder to backups? Thanks in advance for helping. BR Tapio Heikkila
creator: tapio.heikkila

title: Thunderbird crashes on opening
content: If I close Thunderbird (144.0.1) it crashes when I re-open it and I then have to reinstall it. How do I solve this?
creator: jane16

title: UI boxes too small for content
content: I had a problem with an account so Login to SMTP was failing. At this time all dialog boxes were too small to read or even see the text impute area for the password. This was a newly (re)created account inTB. It worked fine to download but would not send. [I eventually solved/worked around this by using a different login name.] However the UI problem is probably still there to be a problem for others. The first "Sending message" box was too small, about 1/4 the normal size I expect, but could be resized if you were quick enough. The Error message and Password Entry boxes would be overlaid and both too small to read content or see the buttons or text entry fields. They could not be resized.
creator: cwinte

title: What does "Move new junk messages to" do?
content: This option can be found in the Junk Settings of each account. My issue is, that I have no option to disable junk filtering through my mail provider and therefore would like to move all messages that end up in my junk folder back into the inbox in thunderbird. Is this option suited for that? Or does "new junk messages" refer to junk messages detected by the thunderbird junk filter? I have adaptive junk mail controls disabled for all accounts. Currently, there is still mail entering the junk folder so I reckon the function does nothing right now.
creator: mongoma123

title: Cannot use personal certificate - err SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER
content: Hello, I am unable to use my personal certificate in Thunderbird (various versions 128-144, x32 or x64, esr or not). It works on one PC, but the same certificate does not work on another. This happens on different PCs, with different certificates, the issuer is always PostSignum ƒåesk√° po≈°ta. Intermediate certificates are installed in Thunderbird, but they do not connect to my personal certificate. In version 144, after pressing test button, I get the error "err SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER."
creator: j.valdauf
